article.title: Euclidean mirrors: enhanced vacuum decay from reflected instantons

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary difference between the assisted (left panel) and standard (right panel) Schwinger mechanisms as depicted in Figure 1?
choices: The assisted mechanism involves a weaker electric field.
The standard mechanism shows a larger instanton path.
The assisted mechanism involves an additional instanton reflection due to the weak rapid field.
The standard mechanism relies on a purely static electric field.

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens to the size of the instanton path with increasing combined Keldysh parameter (γ̃) in Figure 2?
choices: The instanton size increases.
The instanton size remains constant.
The instanton size decreases.
The instanton size oscillates.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key observation from Figure 3 regarding the critical threshold (γ̃crit) for the weak Lorentzian field compared to the weak Sauter field (Figure 2)?
choices: The weak Lorentzian field starts to contribute at a lower γ̃ compared to the weak Sauter field.
The weak Lorentzian field requires a higher γ̃ to contribute compared to the weak Sauter field.
Both fields exhibit the same critical threshold.
The instanton paths are identical for both fields.
The critical combined Keldysh parameter.
The stationary worldline action for the assisted mechanism.
The position of the reflection point.
The momentum spectrum of the produced pair.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the horizontal blue line in Figure 4 represent?
choices: The critical threshold for the weak fields.
The stationary worldline action for a static electric field.
The maximum value of W0.
The LMA condition.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the conditional equation (5.2)?
choices: To determine the critical Keldysh parameter.
To find the improved effective reflection point.
To locate the intersection point between the strong and weak field curves.
To compute the stationary worldline action.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the colored region in Figure 18 (Right) represent?
choices: The region where the weak field contribution is negligible.
The adiabatic nonperturbative regime for the strong field.
The relevant regime for the assisted mechanism.
The region where the LMA condition is violated.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded from Figure 21 regarding the impact of the weak field contribution on the stationary worldline action?
choices: The weak field has a negligible effect on W0.
The weak field significantly reduces W0 when ˜γ is above the critical threshold.
The weak field only contributes when ˜γ is below the critical threshold.
The weak field contribution is independent of the strong field inhomogeneity parameter (γ).
